name: Tortilla Espanola (Spanish Tortilla)
author: sjmoraes
summary: Unlike most omelets, a Spanish tortilla is served at room temperature. It is the classic tapa, prepared all over Spain.
ingredients: 2 pounds baking potatoes, peeled and cut into 1/4-inch slices
1  roasted red pepper, drained and cut into strips
directions: Heat 1/2 cup olive oil in a large skillet over medium-low heat
Add half of the potato slices, and cook, stirring occasionally, until just tender, 15 to 20 minutes
When done, remove potatoes to a large bowl, leaving oil in the skillet
Cook the remaining potatoes in the oil until tender, then add to the bowl, leaving oil in the skillet
Gently toss potatoes with salt and pepper to taste
Meanwhile, heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a skillet over medium heat
Stir in onion rings, and gently cook until soft and golden brown, about 15 minutes
Spoon onions onto a plate, and allow to cool while the potatoes finish cooking
Whisk eggs in a large bowl until smooth
Stir in cooled onions, roasted peppers, and serrano ham
Heat the skillet with the reserved oil over low heat
Pour in the egg mixture, and gently cook until the sides have started to set and the bottom has turned golden brown, 8 to 10 minutes
Loosen the tortilla with a spatula if needed, then carefully slide onto a large plate
Turn the skillet upside down and place onto the uncooked side of the tortilla
Turn the skillet right-side-up, and remove the plate
Return the skillet to the stove, and continue cooking until the tortilla has set in the center, about 4 minutes
Slide the tortilla onto a serving plate and allow to cool to room temperature
Cut into six wedges and sprinkle with parsley to serve
